page.title: 14SUPERNATURAL - GODSHILL
page.content: High on a hill leading from the heart of the village stands the church of All Saints. The legend tells us that in Edward the Confessor's time, they began to build a church on a level site to the south of the village, on the water meadows of Sheepwash_ now Sheepwash Lane. Each day the builders worked;each night the stones were removed to the top of the hill. Twice the builders restarted the following morning on the site they themselves had chosen, but after the third time, they recognised that the miraculous removal of the stones was a clear indication that God intended His Church to be built on the hill_top. Hence the name Godshill_ the hill God chose for His Church.
